Standards.Name: AWS Foundational Security Best Practices v1.0.0
Standards.Description: The AWS Foundational Security Best Practices standard is a set of automated security checks that detect when AWS accounts and deployed resources do not align to security best practices. The standard is defined by AWS security experts. This curated set of controls helps improve your security posture in AWS, and cover AWSâ€™s most popular and foundational services.

Standards.Name: AWS Resource Tagging Standard v1.0.0
Standards.Description: The AWS Resource Tagging standard is a set of automated security checks that detect when AWS resources are not tagged.

Standards.Name: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v1.2.0
Standards.Description: The Center for Internet Security (CIS) AWS Foundations Benchmark v1.2.0 is a set of security configuration best practices for AWS. This Security Hub standard automatically checks for your compliance readiness against a subset of CIS requirements.

Standards.Name: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v1.4.0
Standards.Description: The Center for Internet Security (CIS) AWS Foundations Benchmark v1.4.0 is a set of security configuration best practices for AWS. This Security Hub standard automatically checks for your compliance readiness against a subset of CIS requirements.

Standards.Name: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v3.0.0
Standards.Description: The Center for Internet Security (CIS) AWS Foundations Benchmark v3.0.0 is a set of security configuration best practices for AWS. This Security Hub standard automatically checks for your compliance readiness against a subset of CIS requirements.

Standards.Name: NIST Special Publication 800-171 Revision 2
Standards.Description: NIST Special Publication 800-171 Revision 2 provides recommended security requirements for protecting the confidentiality of Controlled Unclassified Information. This Security Hub standard automatically checks for your compliance readiness against a subset of NIST 800-171 R2 requirements.

Standards.Name: NIST Special Publication 800-53 Revision 5
Standards.Description: NIST Special Publication 800-53 Revision 5 provides a catalog of security and privacy controls for information systems and organizations. This Security Hub standard automatically checks for your compliance readiness against a subset of NIST 800-53 R5 requirements.

Standards.Name: PCI DSS v3.2.1
Standards.Description: The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) v3.2.1 is an information security standard for entities that store, process, and/or transmit cardholder data. This Security Hub standard automatically checks for your compliance readiness against a subset of PCI DSS requirements.

Standards.Name: PCI DSS v4.0.1
Standards.Description: The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) v4.0.1 is an information security standard for entities that store, process, and/or transmit cardholder data. This Security Hub standard automatically checks for your compliance readiness against a subset of PCI DSS V4.0.1 requirements.
